page.shortlink: api a5 get date html function
page.description: Displays a dialog with a popup calendar rendered using HTML.
page.syntax: Selected_Date as C = a5_GetDateHTML(C title ,C default_date ,C style [,L nocaption [,C xdialogPositionCommand ]])

argument.name: Selected_Date
argument.description: The date selected by the user.

argument.name: title
argument.description: Optional. Default = "Calendar". The title of the calendar dialog.

argument.name: default_date
argument.description: Optional. Default = current date. The initial date to show selected in the calendar.

argument.name: style
argument.description: Optional. The path to and filename of a CSS style.

page.discussion:
The A5_GETDATEHTML() function displays an HTML calendar and returns a date value formatted as a character string. The range of years shown is from 1950 to 2050. Note : If you have changed the Xdialog system font setting from its default value, you should use HTML style display. To enable HTML style display, select View > Settings > System > Preferences > Calendar Popup. Select Style and a cascading style sheet from the Value list.
If you use the Xdialog style, you should have your Xdialog system font setting at its default value (Tahoma 8 point). To restore the default font setting select View > Settings > System > System Fonts > Restore Default. These settings also affect POPUP.CALENDAR()and UI_GET_DATE_CALENDAR().
